raw_comment:
1. What do you notice?
I noticed that this graph breaks down peoples ages and surveys whether or not they think that generations to come will make the world a better place or not. I also noticed that people aged 25-39 were not surveyed. 
2. What do you wonder?
I wonder why Indonesia’s results are so high and why Brazil and Mali's results are so low. I wonder if their location impacted their results. I also wonder if these results will change in the future or how these results would have compared to the past. 
3. What impact does this have on you and your community?
This impacts me because I am in the 15-24 year old category and I think that the world is getting better with each generation. Also, I think that my community is very optimistic so they will do everything in  their power to make changes so the world can be a better place. 
4. What's going on in this graph? Write a catchy headline that captures the graph's main idea.
In this graph, we see a graph that displays how different aged people think whether or not the world is getting better with each generation. Headline: “Will the world get better with time? Or will the younger generations be our downfall?
ace_sentences: The graph breaks down the ages of people.
The graph surveys whether people think that future generations will make the world a better place.
People who are 25-39 years old were not surveyed.
I wonder why the results for Indonesia are very high.
I wonder why the results for Brazil are very low.
I wonder why the results for Mali are very low.
I wonder whether the location of a country impacted the results of the country.
I wonder whether these results will change in the future.
I wonder how these results compare to results in the past.
I am in the 15-24 year old category.
I think that the world gets better with each generation.
If a community is optimistic then the community will do everything in its power to make changes.
My community will do everything in its power to make changes.
My community wants the world to be a better place.
The graph displays how people of different ages think about whether the world gets better with each generation.
The headline is: Will the world get better with time?
The headline is: Or will the younger generations be our downfall?
